name: CICS return code should be checked
description: This rule searches for Cobol Programs that do not check return code (specified in RESP clause) after CICS macros.
output:
This rule lists all Cobol Programs that use CICS macros and do not check the RESP return code. 

It provides the following information: 
- Cobol Program full name 
- Number of violations 

It also provides bookmarks for violation patterns found in source code: 
- CICS macro
rationale: CICS macros can throw warnings and errors. It is therefore important to check their return code before executing other statements in order to avoid any unexpected behavior.
remediation: Check return code after CICS macro in order to manage all situation that can occur.
remediationSample:
01 RESP-CODE PIC S9(08) COMP. 
... 
EXEC CICS 
    SEND FROM ( WS-DTA) 
    LENGTH( WS-DTA-SZ) 
    RESP(RESP-CODE) 
END-EXEC. 

IF RESP-CODE = DFHRESP(NORMAL) 
    MOVE 'Y' TO OK-COMMAND 
ELSE 
    IF RESP-CODE = DFHRESP(NOTFND) 
        MOVE 'N' TO REC-NOT-FOUND 
    ELSE 
        PERFORM DISPLAY-MISC-ERROR 
    END-IF 
END-IF 
...

EXEC CICS 
    SEND FROM ( WS-DTA) 
    LENGTH(Ws-DTA-SZ ) 
END-EXEC.
